You interested?

text.comment: We approached you with this operation because you have proved yourself to be a loyal and capable ally to the Terran cause.
While it would be tempting to focus solely on the Xenon threat, neglecting all other dangers would prove to be foolish.

add_npc_line.comment: What are you waiting for, agent? Get out there, Terran security is at stake!
(#angry#)We cannot ever forget the Argon betrayal!

text.comment: The Federation destroyed the Torus, earths main line of defence.
Their terrorist act killed Terran citizens, and caused our Government damages in the trillions!
It was a grave humiliation, not only on the grander political stage, but it was also a blow to the Terran citizens's morale!
All of this over their absurdly tolerant stance on using AGI technology!
The majority of our resources are tied up in the ongoing campaign against the Xenon, but that should not stop us from pre-emptively undermining enemies of democracy.
Technically both the Argon government and the Terran Protectorate have agreed to a truce, and the Secret Services directive is to not engage Argon forces directly.
This is why we approached you for this.
(While you are a Terran citizen, you have no documented ties to the Terran Secret Service.) or (As a third party, you are not a citizen of the Terran government.)
Without a tenable connection to us, operating in Argon space as a free agent will raise less suspicion than one of our own would.
Our own agents are continuously working on finding opportunities to undermine the Argon Federation.
We have identified an Antigone Republic Civil Servant we believe is willing to sell confidential Argon information to the highest bidder.
You are to meet the asset, and, should his intel prove to be legit, obtain said information for us.
It is at this point that I have to inform you that this is a strictly covert operation.

text.comment: The Antigone Republic is a shining example of self-determination.
Looking at everything we have achieved, I cant help but be proud of its people.
We have risen above petty squabbles and have put the interests of the public first.
To see a faction of this considerable power, both economically and politically, arise from what was undoubtedly a stressful and divisive time in history, gives me hope for the future.
The Argon government and us have had our differences in the past.
Initially, they wanted us back in the fold.
Antigone Memorial, our home system, was significant to them, due to its location and its importance to their data infrastructure.
After lengthy talks we came to terms, largely because the Jump Gate shutdown had changed the gate connections, making Antigone Memorials current position less valuable to the Argon.
Both parties realised that there was no way of putting the genie back in the bottle, and that neither one had anything to gain from fighting amongst ourselves.
Not when there are actual enemies at our gates.
Now, we look out for each other. Politics isnt a zero-sum game, after all.
The Terran arrogance will come back to haunt us all.
It is no secret that historically, relations between the Argon Federation and the Terrans have been tense.
And more recently, the Terrans have displayed a blatant disregard of Antigone sovereignty as well.
Should things escalate, it would pain me to see my people caught in the crossfire between the two parties.
Hold on.
Ah, forgive me, my schedule is quite busy.
So, what can I do for you?

text.comment: While you were getting here, I reviewed all our options.
This is a political minefield we got ourselves involved in here, and I felt we needed an accurate picture.
We could hand over the information to the Terran government. After all, we were contracted by them.
Alternatively, we could turn towards the Antigone Republic, let them know what has happened, and return the evidence.
Finally, I could destroy this information. Back out and pretend this whole mess never happened.
While you were getting here, I reviewed all our options.
We would adhere to the initial plan.
You meet with the Terran Secret Service Contact, and you hand over the evidence.
The Terran Protectorate gains their leverage and we get paid.
From what I have gathered they will use the information to sow distrust between the Argon Federation and the Antigone Republic.
The created tension would lead to all cessation of trade between Argon and Antigone, but the Protectorate will not use this information to escalate the situation.
The Terrans first priority is still the Xenon, so this leverage is more of a long-term insurance to keep their rivals weak.
We contact Saman Red, the Antigone Republic Official.
He is already involved in investigating the Terrans, so all we need to do is hand over the evidence.
The Terran Protectorate wont be happy, but I think I can twist this so that they won't trace the leak back to us.
The Antigone Republic and the Argon Federation will remain close allies.
Should Saman go public with this, I cannot imagine the Federation taking such Terran interference lightly.
There is a good chance these tensions will escalate into open war.
Some would argue it is the right thing to do, but we wouldn't get paid, and the ensuing open conflict would be unpredictable, and result in many lost lives.
It's easy.
The Terrans dont know for certain that we managed to access the servers, just that we managed to dock at the station.
All we have to do is tell them we did not get anything off the servers, and quietly erase all the data we managed to get our hands on.
Sure, we wont get paid, and the Terrans will likely just hire someone else to do their dirty work, but we come out clean.
More importantly, the relations between factions won't change, for better or for worse. Business as usual.
Just follow through with the final debrief.
I hope you made the right choice.
You will need to meet with the Antigone Republic Official, then.
I will call in advance and set things up.
Ill tell the Terrans their Sandwell Archive Pass didn't manage to pull of any info.
Hold on for dear life, we are about to blow this thing wide open.
Let me take these files off your hands.
You know, for what its worth, I think this might have been for the best.
Let me make some calls.
Ill tell the Terrans their Sandwell Archive Pass didn't manage to pull of any info.
So, what are we going to do?
